name: Loews Miami Beach Hotel

reviews.text: Great location, and nice hotel, but nothing special as luxury properties go. The pool is fine, but nothing special (neither adult and exotic nor fun and kid-friendly). The rooms are clean and nice, but a pet-peeve is the sliding glass bathroom door that doesn't lock and sheds light and noise. Awkward if you are there with anyone other than the most intimate companions.
reviews.title: Fine, but non impressive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you expect expert concierge service, forget it. 2 out of 3 whom I spoke with were unhelpful and didn't seem to know anything. When asked for dinner recs, they could only offer a pre-printed map and list. One concierge, Daniel, stood out. He was knowledgeable and helpful. For it's price, the Loews really needs to step it up a notch in service.
reviews.title: Hospitality plus

reviews.text: This hotel excels at Customer Service. Every employee is imbued with the spirit of hospitality. It is a lovely property excellently located at the heart of South Beach. It has the most magnificent pool. Great restaurants are all a short walk away. The beach is right behind the hotel and you can go out a good way before the shelf drops off and you can't stand in the water. When reserving online, I noted that this was a special occasion and when we checked in, they brought up that it was the occasion and fulfilled all my requests (without my having to ask). I would certainly go back again!
reviews.title: Cannot fault the Loews

reviews.text: We were there on a Stag (batchelor) party..
reviews.title: Great location. Good hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 4 nights at the Loews... Perfect Location, Good Value, Excellent Pool, Top Class Spa & Fitness Centre... Just excellent all over... Couldnt ask for any more.
reviews.title: Beauty of a hotel, brings you back in time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our initial "feel" of this hotel was it was factory-like, large and impersonal. That was unfair, it remained impersonal but the property overall is excellent with the best staffed pool we have used.
reviews.title: Good experience if impersonal

reviews.text: We took a junior suit which seem to be all on the 4th floor and overlooked Collins Avenue rather than the beach but was very roomy. Despite this noise and hence sleeping wasn't a problem.
reviews.title: Good pool for kids and great location but has its ups and downs

reviews.text: The Loews has great access to the beach and is handy for the restaurants on Ocean Drive or Lincoln Avenue. Forget the dreadful hotel breakfast and instead walk the 100 yards to Jerry's Deli on Collins - excellent.
reviews.title: large property for a family experience only

reviews.text: In spite of the fact that it was apparently a school holiday week the hotel is so large it didn't impact on us.
reviews.title: Great Place, but Pretentious Bathroom Renovations and Pet friendly attitudes that I dread while there!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Loews may lack some of the atmosphere of say the Delano but it delivers a very pleasant experience.
reviews.title: value for money? absolutely not

reviews.text: This was our first stay at Miami Beach and the hotel couldn't be more fantastic!
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: All the staff was friendly, attencious and professional, starting at the check-in till the check-out.
reviews.title: WOW

reviews.text: Our group was very large (14 people with children) and some stayed in the main tower and others, including myself, at the St. Moritz tower.
reviews.title: Another fabulous stay at the Loews
Great hotel
reviews.text: All the rooms were excelent and exceeded everybody's expectations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool and, all the staff and the ammenities were great! The fact that the pool is open 24 hours is a plus that we can't ignore.
reviews.title: Beautiful beach resort close to the action of South Beach

reviews.text: The Hotel is in world class, the service is done to the fingertips. Everything you Ask for, you'll Get it. You really feel welcome and like a superstar at this Hotel.
reviews.title: Here they know service, and it's a good place to be.

reviews.text: The Sushibar have exellent sushi, you Get what you pay for.
reviews.title: great place for a family vacation in South Beach!

reviews.text: The poolarea is big and there is space for everyone. The only negative thing i could mention is that the poolbar restaurant close a little bit to early.
reviews.title: A wonderful vacation at the Loews and in Miami

reviews.text: The view from my room was fantastic! Seaview from level 8.
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.text: Our family has been going here for years. Its a wonderful place to go and relax and sit by the pool.
reviews.title: Great Location fun area

reviews.text: To all Tripadvisor members, I would think long and hard before you decide to stay in Loews Miami Beach Hotel. Please read my husband's review below.
reviews.title: We will never stay in Loews ever again.

reviews.text: As you can see from Loews' pro-forma reply, they can surely talk the talk. Everybody can say that they celebrate diversity, but putting it into practice is a separate matter altogether.
reviews.title: Bad experience at Loew's Miami Hotel

reviews.text: I encourage the members to read all the "terrible" and "poor" reviews about this hotel, and you will conclude that this is not an isolated incident.
reviews.title: Bad experience in Loew's Miami

reviews.text: My wife, son and I checked-in at Loew's Miami Beach Hotel on July 28, my birthday. Being a luxury resort hotel, we were expecting a relaxing time for 4 days.
reviews.title: I will be coming back again next year 2011.

reviews.text: On our third day in the hotel, while we were on our way to the swimming pool, security stopped us and asked for our hotel keycard. While my wife was looking for the keycard in her bag, another family passed by, but security did not ask for their keycard. I was a bit insulted, but decided to shrug it off.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel/Staff

reviews.text: When I pulled up to the hotel I was greeted by the friendliest staff. They gladly took our luggage off our hands and would delivery it to our room when it was ready (we showed up at 11am and check in wasn't until 4pm). We opted to park across the street in the garage since it was much cheaper than valet. When we went to check in is when I realized how huge the hotel actually is. The lobby was beautiful and there were plenty of people working to speed up the process. Luckily they had a room ready for us right away, which was a bonus. The room was clean, stylish and had a cozy feel to it. Every staff member was so helpful and kind. The pool and services were A+! My only complaint is that it cost money to rent a lounge chair on the beach and the drinks were a little over priced. Aside from those two things the hotel is top notch. I will definitely stay at a Loews again!
reviews.title: Worth every penny!

reviews.text: I went to South Beach for a 4 day getaway and stayed at Loew's Hotel in their Luxury King suite from March 29th to April 2nd. The room had old furnishings, nothing what their website showed. Housekeeping did not replenish the glassware used or toiletries for the entire stay. The whole experience was disappointing. To add insult to the whole experience there was an automatic 20% gratuity added to all services.
reviews.title: Easter Getaway

reviews.text: Here for a business conference but extended my trip before and after. Hotel is beautiful. The staff have been excellent, friendly, and welcoming. The bartenders at nautilus (pool bar) were engaging and made great drinks! The pool is pretty large so there was plenty of room. Great location. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just spent 3 nights here on a combo of business/vacation. Overall, the hotel and its grounds are very nice and very well located close to everything. The price wasn't bad as I had a special negotiated rate because of the meeting I was attending. I can see how it is considered expensive by anyone paying "rack" rate sinceI tried to extend past the dates of the meeting and was rather put off by the price.
reviews.title: Very nice with a few buts...
Great for families
reviews.text: The service by everyone with whom we interacted was excellent. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Now, the "buts:

reviews.title: Loews
reviews.text: I accompanied hubby on a business trip recently, 1st trip to Miami! Loved the look of the hotel surroundings/lobby from the start. We both commented, that it seemed like a place "Sinatra would have visited." Our initial room had a great room but no balcony. Windows opened an inch. Coming from 6 months of snow and cold...we needed a balcony!! Hubby called down and the person at the desk was VERY accommodating. He gave us a room on the same floor. Balcony was awesome, view fantastic!! Weather was amazing!! The room was clean, comfy bed, nice flat screen TV. The grounds were very nice. Nautilus was nice, expensive drinks, then again,, you're in South Beach. Friendly people. The pool was pretty. Loaded with kids every day/all day! Since we weren't early enough to get a seat at the pool (9:30am on a Wed, due to an event taking over the grounds), hubby asked for 2 towels. The woman said "There's no chairs available." That was it! We then watched as they rolled out stacks of chairs as people came down to the pool. My husband was completely put off! We didn't bother to say anything, since we were checking out at 12....but really?? Also, the hot tub was not available our last day, with a sign that said "Closed" (which was constantly full of children previously), so we hit the SOAK hot tub. They should have an adults only hot tub, or not the ONLY hot tub (minus Soak) be monitored. We heard many people comment on this, so maybe something to think about? The restaurants were amazing. Location great! Wish we could comment on the spa but we didn't have the time.

This is my 2nd stay . We stayed from 4/9. - 4/14. So far it has been great. Very nice place to stay. Close to everything. Rooms are ok but need better bed To firm For me. Staffs are great very eager to please. I am happy we stayed at the loews. Hope to be back next year.
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for a first class resort in the heart of South Beach the Loews Miami Beach should suite all of your needs. It has the Ritz-Carlton South Beach beat in curb appeal, facilities, and most importantly-the top notch service of all staff you encounter.
reviews.title: much better than the ritz-carlton south beach

reviews.text: I am very hard to please when it comes to hotels, and I cannot find a fault with this one. (Well, the internet connection in the room was sometimes slow and that was frustrating). I had a partial ocean view room with balcony (room number ending in "45"...any odd number above that would have had even a better view, though not all have balconies). I could see the ocean both from the room and from the balcony, while sitting down (I hate hotels rooms that claim partial ocean view but you can see it only when standing an craning your neck!). The room had a chair with ottoman, a comfortable desk chair, and another straight back chair. (I had a room with two beds and there was not much free space around the furniture...certainly for more than two people it would have been small). The shower had great water pressure. The bathroom was beautiful, but only one sink. The service was excellent. The breakfast buffet, while expensive ($28), had good food. I got slippers from housekeeping. There is a lovely fish tank in the lobby with information about all the fish. The location is great for both the beach and Lincoln Road. The pool was crowded and quite the party scene, but that's to be expected (I was there for a conference and didn't try to mingle with the real partiers). I'm not really a Miami Beach person, but I would definitely pick this hotel again if I were to travel there.
reviews.title: This is a terrific hotel

reviews.text: The only reason I stayed here was that I was attending a conference. I reserved two nights at the Shore Club after the conference for a leisure weekend. In retrospect, I wish I had stayed on at the Loews. What impressed me most about the Loews was not its physical facility (although the hotel, pool and rooms are very nice), but its people. Everyone was friendly and responsive, from the doormen and front desk folks to the housekeeper. Maybe I just lucked out and encountered their best employees, but I suspect that this is a hotel with a superb human resources department that recruits the best employees and treats them well. The only hotels where I have encountered similar service is at Four Seasons hotels, albeit at a much higher cost. Keep up the good work!
reviews.title: Unexpectedly wonderfull
Awesome Hotel & Accommodations
reviews.text: Superior service and amenities! Was treated like a king there, staff was excellent, food was of course pricey but overall excellent hotel and service. No complaints.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was thinking what to write and how to start, but i have only one thing and one word in my mind.
reviews.title: Just perfect

reviews.text: Had a great 4 night stay here with two children - 8 and 6. We have travelled without kids to south beach before and stayed in more adult friendly places and the Loews did a good job of combining a child friendly property while being close to the restaurants and shopping of ocean drive and Lincoln road. Our boys really enjoyed the pool area which had plenty of balls, rafts and noodles to keep them happy. The restaurant (Prestons) served great seafood for us while also doing a good kids menu and the service was great both evenings we dined there. There is a kids club at the hotel which is housed in quite a small room but compensated for by the fact the staff were really good and organised several activities which meant it was tough to get our kids to leave. We used it now and then so we could go shopping on Lincoln road or enjoy a quiet lunch. only negatives are that the pool area is a little crowded and you have to pay for things which usually come as standard in similar resorts such as beach loungers and the kids club but set against that the price of food and drinks is quite reasonable. Overall we were v happy with the experience and hope to go back sometime - good combination of a kid friendly resort while being close to the amenities of south beach.
reviews.title: Good kid friendly option in south beach

reviews.text: Overall a great place for a family to stay, particularly if you understand that hotels in miami beach are expensive and rooms not too large. Its sort of a nice, corporate feel here, but everything is of pretty high quality and well done. Its a safe bet, particularly if you have kids.
reviews.title: Great, large hotel - shame they nickel and dime you

reviews.text: We went with our small kids and paid what i would call a lot for a modest room. Most rooms are not direct ocean view rooms, but look sideways at the ocean and the city. Pool is great, kids club program was great. Staff was very very friendly - this may have been what kept the place in a more premium category as opposed to more of a standard experience -- which would be easy given the size of the hotel. Location is tremendous if you like the main strip but want some reasonable levels of quiet too.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in the Heart of SoBe!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only thing we hated about this place was being nickel and dimed. We spent a lot of money on the room alone, so why charge for internet, premium prices on bagels (with 20% gratuity added on to a person serving you coffee, etc). My wife and I added up the cost of these extras and it was so small compared to the total bill, but it was annoying, and contrasted the friendly staff attitude. I'm sure those extras add up for hotel management, but they kill the premium experience. Also, the internet in the room did not work, so that was double annoying because I had to sit on line, waiting for a serice I paid for, which never worked.
reviews.title: Very nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Note to management: I just got free internet in a $100 doubletree guest suite in Memphis. Why would a $600-per-night hotel in Miami charge me?
reviews.title: fabulous stay!

reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights during a trip to Florida, should have stayed longer as the hotel and location was absolutely perfect.
reviews.title: What a location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was fantastic (partial sea view) with champagne and chocolate strawberry's on our arrival. The beach and pool services were fantastic with the staff very friendly and helpful. The atmosphere around the pool on the saturday was amazing with live music, cocktails and plenty going on.
reviews.title: A great location for a beautiful hotel

reviews.text: Would definately return.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel

reviews.text: I really should raate thios 4 1/2 stars because there was only one glitch that prevented it from being a 5. We had purposely booked a premium king room because it stted ocean view instead of a less expensive partial ocean view room. When we arrived, our room had a partial ocean view. When we complained the person at check in told us that a full ocean view was called oceanfront and would cost more. Although he did give us a $50 food credit, it is something to be aware of.
reviews.title: Been here a couple of times and still love it

reviews.text: Otherwise the hotel was terrific. The lobby is beautiful and the pool has plenty of chairs and the service people were accomodating. You can go right to the beach and third party folks will rent you a cabana for $50 for the full day. The location is great easy walking distance to Ocean Drive and Lincoln Road.
reviews.title: Great Location, Nice Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed for three nights - amazing hotel, beautiful rooms. nicest of the Loews I've stayed in (previously stayed in Loews Coronado Bay). Pool is beautiful, plenty of chairs, plus two green lawns for sunning. Steps to the beach through the back gate, ocean is calm and warm, with a huge expanse of beach. Had a great business experience for a conference, nice ballrooms, very friendly staff, but also believe it would be a great couples getaway. Restaurant food was wonderful, had lots of meals through the conference provided by the hotel, and food was always delicious. Breakfast a la carte in the lobby was very nice. Great views from most rooms. Running/walking trail through the back gate of the hotel. Finally understand why everyone loves Miami!
reviews.title: Gorgeous - great for vacation or a conference

reviews.text: Also went off the resort some, wasn't the nicest area, but I've never been to MIami before this. Walgreens around the corner is very convenient. Great karaoke bar across the street.
reviews.title: Fantastic service, outstanding staff, beautiful resort -- must stay at Loews!!

reviews.text: We had the pleasure of enjoying 8 days of fantastic service provided by outstanding staff at the beautiful Loews on Miami Beach. Christine Prado at the front desk went above and beyond the call of duty consistently, to ensure that our every request was met with excellence, professionalism and respect. Joan in security kept us safe at the entrances and exceeded our expectations with respect to confidentiality and kindness in greeting my family every day as we entered the pool area. Joan was discrete, professional, generous and truly smart in managing all the guests with excellence!! Pool side pampering provided by Beatrix was luxurious -- frozen grapes, chilled towels, positive handling of our needs. In fact, we were very appreciative of the multicultural, diverse, multi-lingual staff who treated us like royalty. Sandra and Samuel and Splash ensured that all of our extra splurges were managed with a smile. We are returning in 3 months. The resort is beautiful, restaurants within walking distance and staff absolutely GREAT!!
reviews.title: Great sevice

reviews.text: I stayed at Loews in March 2010 while traveling for business. This was my second trip to Miami Beach for business and I chose this hotel on the recommendation of some colleagues. Right away I was impressed. I was offered an upgrade to a room with a balcony with a partial ocean view. The pool area was relaxing and Emerils restaurant was fantastic. I can't say enough about the location - a stones throw from Lincoln Road and close to Ocean Drive. I'd definately stay there again.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is truly all about comfort and pampering. Loews delivers outstanding service and provides a schedule of daily activities for children and adults. The hotel is excellent for families with children. Little things like receiving the New York Times delivered to our door every morning, and complimentary passion fruit lemonades at the lobby every afternoon made our stay delightful. The pool is well maintained and very nice. Complimentary fruit infused water and suntan lotion misting is provided. Access to the beach is just steps away. One negative is the walls tend to be thin, so try to get a room where there isn't a lot of traffic. Otherwise, you'll hear people talking and passing through the halls at night. Also, dining at the hotel can be pricey (plus an 18% gratuity is automatically added to your bill). Overall, it's a wonderful hotel despite the minor negatives mentioned. I would definitely return to this hotel for its amenities, service and location.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in MIAMI SOUTH BEACH

reviews.text: Recently stayed at the Loews in South Beach. It is a lovely property, well maintained and a great location to both Ocean Dr and Lincoln where you find shopping and restaurants. Overall, a really nice experience and will go back (this was the 2nd stay at this property). The initial check in was a bit frustrating as the room was not ready when we arrived at 2:00pm (we understand there is a 4:00 check in) and it took another 2 1/2 - 3 hours before we were given access to a room. The first time I checked status, the Front Desk was great and very apologetic. The second time I checked, not so much. The Front Desk clerk was very rude (believe his name was David). The accommodations were nice, the cleaning staff very good (Tracy), and the rest of our interaction with hotel staff (pool and bar area) great. Very attentive. Of course, with it being Spring Break and crowded, getting pool chairs was an issue. Had to get up early each day just to get a somewhat decent chair at the pool area (never made it early enough to get a chair by the pool). Wish there were a better way. Again, it was a good stay and would recommend the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - Good Service - Expensive

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Loews Miami Beach with my husband & children prior to leaving on a cruise from the Port of Miami. The location is excellent, and is within walking distance to everything you would want to see in Miami Beach. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel itself, and our room were beautiful, and very clean. The size of our room was on the small side, but it had all of the usual amenities. The pool is very nice and was heated. If you intend to spend time by the pool, head down there early in the day. If not, you will not find an open lounge chair. Also, don't plan on "saving" a chair because the pool staff will remove your belongings if you are not actually using the chair. Throughout the day, various chidren's activities were offered by the pool, which my children enjoyed. The beach was large, with white sand, and the water was a beautiful blue color. We found the ocean temperature to be quite cold (in April), and there was a lot of sea weed washed up on the shore. I'm not sure if that is typical for Miami Beach, or not. The food & beverages at the hotel were expensive, but there was a great coffee shop right in front of the hotel that had coffee and food at a reasonable price. There are also many restaurants within walking distance. We all enjoyed our stay at this property, and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.
reviews.title: Great location and family friendly.

reviews.text: Stayed here on business for nearly a week. Awesome stay. This beachside hotel is very close to all the action South Beach has to offer. Easily within stumbling distance.
reviews.title: Great Beach, Pool, and Close to the Action

reviews.text: The beach itself is beautiful. Just a quick walk by the great pool and you are on the beach. Beachside wait service is a plus. Be prepared to pay $15 per drink and $30 for a hamburger. That being said, you're eating a burger and drinking a margarita ON MIAMI BEACH. That's gonna demand a high premium. The pool is a wonderful place to relax. Some kids, but not overwhelming. Lots of chairs to choose from in many different areas. Rooms are nicely appointed and very quiet. Found the housekeeping service to be on target.
reviews.title: Overpriced, the rooms weren't impressive

reviews.text: While I was here on business this time, I wouldn't hesitate bringing the family to this hotel...resort really. You'll pay for the location and amenities, but you'll enjoy the convenience and beauty of it all.
reviews.title: Beautiful with Decent Service but Very, Very Expensive

description: Welcome to Loews Miami Beach Hotel, the perfect “SoBe style” fusion of cosmopolitan and Art Deco. The hotel features a beachfront, Splash boutique, palm tree lined promenade, oceanfront pool, Elemis Spa and Fitness Center, and seven restaurants and bars. This South Beach hotel just completed $50 million renovations, including a completely redesigned lobby and guestrooms.
